Articles.Content:
Now all messages about all of your packs will be posted here...oh god.

There\'s going to be at least a hundred pages by March.

Now all messages about all of your packs will be posted here...oh god.

There\'s going to be at least a hundred pages by March.

Better than hunting for a thread and dredging it from the deep.
Oh god.
Oh. Glad I saw someone mention the Plywood Flyer wasn\'t there. I have been wondering where I could get it, saw it in a bunch of pictures.
Oh man Silisko, I SO wish I could have an imagination as great as you.
I have to say, that plywood flier actually made me laugh. It\'s about as \'kerbal\' as it gets.
Feh, got caught up making music and forgot I was supposed to be working on new stuff.
Are you going to link to SIDR?

Are you going to link to SIDR?

No. It\'s been converted into NovaPunch, and Tiberion is in charge of that.
Re-added silisko edition to the first post.
[shadow=blue,right]You had me all excited that a revision was inbound.[/shadow]
Are you making the next version of BACE or will you wait for V0.14?

Are you making the next version of BACE or will you wait for V0.14?

Hopefully I can produce enough in the time before 0.14 is released to warrant an update.

[shadow=blue,right]You had me all excited that a revision was inbound.[/shadow]

My eyes hurt now.
[shadow=red,left]Yeah, I\'m not really sure why they let us do this...[/shadow]

Yeah, I\'m not really sure why they let us do this.

You had me all excited that a revision was inbound.

Don\'t do that.

I\'m curious, what was the design choice behind making all the BACE parts command pods? I\'d like to be able to drop off a bunch at once. Also, why no top attach nodes? These would go well with the antennae and such from Probodobodyne.

I\'m curious, what was the design choice behind making all the BACE parts command pods? I\'d like to be able to drop off a bunch at once. Also, why no top attach nodes? These would go well with the antennae and such from Probodobodyne.

Next release will have top attach nodes, so you can fly more than one. The reasoning behind them being command pods is that they\'re intended for use with persistence.
Now that you mention it, I\'d like to be able to stack em all on top of each other, then drop each of them off in a neat little circle. Base camp!

Now that you mention it, I\'d like to be able to stack em all on top of each other, then drop each of them off in a neat little circle. Base camp!

Exactly my thoughts. I was planning to put 4 habitat modules and a cargo rack under a 5x1 adaptor plate, with a small ship built on top of that. Drop off the base parts, then hover up and off to the side with the ship which has antennae and cameras and such.

Nova, I\'ve just found something weird with the probodobodyne strut. I\'ve never had problems attaching other things from the kit to it, but the solar panels are rotating around the end. The very end is the only place they can be attached sticking straight out.
I don\'t think I can fix that. KSP\'s symmetry still is very weird at times...
You need to place the strut onto a node, attach the parts, then drag/copy the strut to where you want it go.

Nova, I\'ve just found something weird with the probodobodyne strut. I\'ve never had problems attaching other things from the kit to it, but the solar panels are rotating around the end. The very end is the only place they can be attached sticking straight out.

This happens when you\'re trying to add things to the side assemblies on 'the Node.' Build your fully constructed antenna below 'the Node,' then rotate it to the side.

I don\'t think I can fix that. KSP\'s symmetry still is very weird at times...

I can\'t even put a few winglets on my ship anymore...

I can\'t even put a few winglets on my ship anymore...

This is humor(es?) to me.

Humorous.

Winglet problems? I haven\'t had any with my newest aircraft builds when it came to symmetry... how detailed are the pieces in terms of how many pieces does it take to get to the center?
